intro: Thelypodium brachycarpum, commonly known as the narrow-fruited thelypodium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in dry, rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features slender, upright stems with small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Thelypodium brachycarpum is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
